moves.1. e4 c5: I find this game interesting and  therefor I have decided to annotate it.
moves.2. c4 Nc6 3. Nc3 e6: black start with a rather unusual moves and it looks like they are loosing the center
moves.4. Nf3 a6 5. d4 d6: white now has three pawns on the 4 line and has a rather good prospective to attack in the center with a d5 move
moves.6. d5 Ne5 7. Nxe5 dxe5: black tries to get a good position for his knight but is stopped
moves.8. Qh5: white makes a very aggressive move that in this case is a mistake because the queen has little support and the pawn on e5 can be easily defended.
moves.9. Bd3: Bg5 would have continued the attack
moves.9... g6: black want to force the queen away and to have a prospective to launch a pawn attack at the wing
moves.10. Qf3 f5: black prepare to launch the attack with the pawns if the white king castles on his side
moves.11. O-O: the white makes the  mistake which the black are waiting for and castles his king on the side which is under the pressure of the black pawns
moves.11... f4 12. b3 Qe7 13. a4: white pawns are moving at the other wing wanting to attack first
moves.13... Nf6: black are securing the important square at g4
moves.14. Ba3 b6 15. Bb2: white are making pointless moves with the bishop and are giving time to the black
moves.15... Bb7 16. a5 g5 17. Qe2: black continue their attack with the pawns forcing the  white queen to move
moves.17... h5 18. f3: white try to add more pressure on g4
moves.19... hxg4 20. axb6: white are trying to launch an attack on their own on the other wing
moves.20... O-O-O 21. dxe6: white decide to free space for a Nd5 move and to free the white bishop
moves.21... Rh4: black are securing g4 and adding the rook to the attack. I  think that Qxe6 would be better
moves.22. Nd5 Qxe6 23. Nxf6: white decide to attack and are hoping to draw attention from the attack in the wing
moves.23... f3 24. gxf3 Qxf6: the pressure on the white king is raising
moves.25. Bc3 Rg8: the white face a disastrous gxf3+ 27 Kh1 fxe2 option
moves.26... g3: the situation becomes even more complicated
moves.27. Rfg1 Rxh2+: it looks like the white are in a desperate situation but they are not. the black aren't realising that they are changing two rooks and a pawn for a queen
moves.28. Qxh2 gxh2 29. Rxg8+: the queen and the two rooks are gone and the black king is check
moves.31... Qh4+ 32. Kg2: the king finds a very good position
moves.32... Qf4 33. Rd1+ Ke7 34. Rd3 Bc6: better decision here would be Qc1
white are trying to make a queen and they take a bishop too
moves.40. Rxb7 Qc6 41. Rb8+ Kf7 42. Rgg8 Qa4: the black queen is forced to go away
moves.43. Rbf8+ Bxf8: but white makes a little mistake
moves.44. Rxf8+ Kxf8 45. b7 Qe8: black decides not to take the bishop and let the white to make a queen
moves.46. Bc7 Qg6+ 47. Kf2 Qe8 48. b8=Q Qxb8 4: and with this the game is decided

gameName: The interesting story of the queen and the two rooks
